    • Constructor Detail

      • PRGRandom

        public PRGRandom(byte[] seed)
        Create a new PRG-based random number generator. This will be fast for generating long sequences of random bytes. If seed is not null, it will be used to seed the generator instead of a securely generated random seed (the output of the PRG is deterministically computed from the seed in this case).
        Parameters:
        seed -

      • PRGRandom

        public PRGRandom()
        Constructs a new PRG-based random number generator with a randomly generated seed. (equivalent to calling PRGRandom(byte[]) with a null parameter).

      • nextBytes

        public void nextBytes(byte[] bytes,
                      int offset,
                      int len)
        Identical to nextBytes(byte[]), except allows writing into a subset of the array
        Parameters:
        bytes - output array
        offset - offset at which to start writing
        len - number of bytes to write.
